home_page.side_text: Colonel By Secondary School's Student Council
home_page.title: Colonel By's Student Council

content_segment1.main_text: The student council is the elected governing body of the school. Students on the student council plan, organize and execute school activities, including spirit weeks, caf events and school dances.
content_segment1.detail1: The student council is the hub for your student experience. Every year, the CB StudCo holds hundreds of events: there’s something for everyone! Keep reading to learn more about what events are coming up soon.
content_segment1.detail2: There are many ways for you to get involved with the Student Council. You can run to be a student representative, voice your opinions or leave suggestions for future activities. Click on the representatives or voice page to find out how.

content_segment2.main_text: The student council is composed of diverse student representatives. The student council meets once a week for the planning and execution of all student-life school activities.
content_segment2.detail1: The student council is a large executive comittee, generally composed of co-presidents, public affairs officers, spirit coordinators, grade representatives, a treasurer, a student senator and CougarVision representatives.
content_segment2.detail2: If you want to be involved with planning school-wide activities, you should consider joining the student council. You can run for all of the positions by making an application during either grade representative or general council elections.

about_page.side_text: Colonel By Secondary School's Student Council
about_page.title: About the Student Council

content_segment1.main_text: The student council is a student-led organization that exists to share ideas, interests and concerns with teachers. It is responsible for the planning of school-wide activities, including social events and community projects.
content_segment1.detail1: Through activities and projects, the student council seeks to promote citizenship, scholarship, leadership, human relations, cultural and cultural values in the interest of augmenting the student body’s experience at Colonel By.
content_segment1.detail2: The student council is the hub for your student experience. Every year, the CB StudCo holds hundreds of events: there’s something for everyone! Keep reading to learn more about what events are coming up soon.

content_segment2.main_text: There are a myriad of ways for you to get involved with the student council. As a member of the student body, you can leave suggestions for the student council activities. You can also run to be elected as a student council representative.
content_segment2.detail1: To leave suggestions for upcoming activities, such as spirit weeks, school dances and other events, you can submit a the ‘your voice’ form by navigating to the ‘Voice’ page (through the nav link) and filling out the form.
content_segment2.detail2: If you want to be directly involved with the planning of school-wide activities, you should consider joining the student council. You can run for all of the positions by making an application during either grade representative or general council elections.

representatives_page.side_text: Colonel By Secondary School's Student Council
representatives_page.title: Student Council Representatives

content_segment1.main_text: The student council is a student-led organization, meaning that it is the elected governing body of the school. There are lots of executive positions on the student council, each responsible for a different part of the planning of school-wide activities.
content_segment1.detail1: There are two primary types of positions on the student council. There are two grade representatives for each grade as well as a combination of a president and vice-president or two co-presidents, public affairs officers, spirit coordinators, a treasurer and a student senator.
content_segment1.detail2: Together, the student council members are leaders who represent the student body when it comes to making decisions regarding upcoming school-wide events.

content_segment2.article_title: Want to join the student council?
content_segment2.main_text: If you want to be a leader in the student body and are interested in the planning, organizing and execution of school-wide activities, you should consider joining the student council by getting elected for an executive position or as grade rep.
content_segment2.detail1: Executive positions (i.e. presidents, public affairs officers, spirit coordinators and treasurers) are elected a year in advance (2020-2021 executive representatives are elected in the 2019-2020 school year). These representatives have focused roles in the student council.
content_segment2.detail2: Grade representatives are elected at the beginning of each school year. From each grade, two students become the year’s grade representatives. To learn more about each position, scroll down below or ask specific questions through the contact page.

positions.title: Co-presidents
positions.description: The co-presidents are responsible for organizing and coordinating all the other student council representatives. The co-presidents are also in charge for the planning of events.
